AI Bytes (
) Office Hours Pilot Launch!
Hello awesome product leaders
Exciting news! We're officially kicking off the
AI Bytes Office Hours
, and I invite you to join the first sessions.
You can find the booking link here

This initiative is still fresh off the press and in these initial stages, I (Adam) will be leading the sessions. The rest of the AI Bytes council is currently focused on various activities to maximize value across the organization. You can read more about that here in the overview that
is helping keep glued together beyond our borders
here
and share your feedback on the AI Bytes specific vision
here
(you can also view v0.1 but that's just talk, now v0.2 is all about action)

.

My goal with these office hours is to be your partner in navigating and leveraging AI.
Please come with your problems and challenges

, and we will pair together to explore how AI can provide solutions. By no means do I consider myself an expert, but I do love learning new things and I've personally haven't been excited about anything in tech for almost over a decade - this much joy last time I had it was almost over a decade ago when Rails 2.0 came out.
To give you an idea of what I'm already working on with others:
Today, in a session with

, we decided to experiment with Playwright and Claude Code on Monday. The aim is to see if we can automate the review of specific user journeys and understand how this can aid in accelerating monolith deprecation.
also reached out to brainstorm how we might leverage our AI tooling to build prototypes to showcase ideas instead of relying on people to read dozens of WBDs (Working Backwards Documents).
I'm also developing an
"AI Bytes Daily Tips" bot

. This bot will help with micro-steps to encourage everyone to use AI more effectively in their day-to-day work. Once it's ready, I plan to host a showcase demonstrating how I built it and how you could build or "hire" AI agents for your own team.

I look forward to seeing you there and working together on your AI challenges!

Please feel free to share this with PMs on your team as well directly of course but I will have to be picky with problem requests that maximise the most value as we also head into YP 2026. So I also expect you as leaders to do a bit of filtering to help me out here as time is the scarcest of resources.

Looking forward team

attachments.fallback:
[September 2nd, 2025 5:10 PM] adam.ghanem: *AI Bytes (<#C08S9HTTYCB|>) Office Hours Pilot Launch!*

Hello awesome product leaders :wave::skin-tone-3:

Exciting news! We're officially kicking off the *AI Bytes Office Hours*, and I invite you to join the first sessions.

:link: *<https://calendar.app.google/8FQxDfSUaYvffpHC6|You can find the booking link here>* :calendar1:

This initiative is still fresh off the press and in these initial stages, I (Adam) will be leading the sessions. The rest of the AI Bytes council is currently focused on various activities to maximize value across the organization. You can read more about that here in the overview that <@U01DZ1QG1UL> is helping keep glued together beyond our borders *<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FNJX26laee0O1kzwYEjxhBJwxuGengVKa8QJpnaDM7M/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.t0f6sdliyxya|here>* and share your feedback on the AI Bytes specific vision <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1glvfwK4E2xUDdk8pxZFGR8JSiMtoyjKqsIZaU1duOgU/edit?tab=t.wzoif9pr422c|here> _(you can also view v0.1 but that's just talk, now v0.2 is all about action)_.

My goal with these office hours is to be your partner in navigating and leveraging AI.

*Please come with your problems and challenges*, and we will pair together to explore how AI can provide solutions. By no means do I consider myself an expert, but I do love learning new things and I've personally haven't been excited about anything in tech for almost over a decade - this much joy last time I had it was almost over a decade ago when Rails 2.0 came out.

*To give you an idea of what I'm already working on with others:*
• Today, in a session with <@UBDB3FVGS>, we decided to experiment with Playwright and Claude Code on Monday. The aim is to see if we can automate the review of specific user journeys and understand how this can aid in accelerating monolith deprecation.
• <@U05NT0X7HLK> also reached out to brainstorm how we might leverage our AI tooling to build prototypes to showcase ideas instead of relying on people to read dozens of WBDs (Working Backwards Documents).
• I'm also developing an <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C08S9HTTYCB/p1756382735169859|"AI Bytes Daily Tips" bot>. This bot will help with micro-steps to encourage everyone to use AI more effectively in their day-to-day work. Once it's ready, I plan to host a showcase demonstrating how I built it and how you could build or "hire" AI agents for your own team.
I look forward to seeing you there and working together on your AI challenges!

Please feel free to share this with PMs on your team as well directly of course but I will have to be picky with problem requests that maximise the most value as we also head into YP 2026. So I also expect you as leaders to do a bit of filtering to help me out here as time is the scarcest of resources.

Looking forward team :slightly_smiling_face:
attachments.text:
*AI Bytes (<#C08S9HTTYCB|>) Office Hours Pilot Launch!*

Hello awesome product leaders :wave::skin-tone-3:

Exciting news! We're officially kicking off the *AI Bytes Office Hours*, and I invite you to join the first sessions.

:link: *<https://calendar.app.google/8FQxDfSUaYvffpHC6|You can find the booking link here>* :calendar1:

This initiative is still fresh off the press and in these initial stages, I (Adam) will be leading the sessions. The rest of the AI Bytes council is currently focused on various activities to maximize value across the organization. You can read more about that here in the overview that <@U01DZ1QG1UL> is helping keep glued together beyond our borders *<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FNJX26laee0O1kzwYEjxhBJwxuGengVKa8QJpnaDM7M/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.t0f6sdliyxya|here>* and share your feedback on the AI Bytes specific vision <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1glvfwK4E2xUDdk8pxZFGR8JSiMtoyjKqsIZaU1duOgU/edit?tab=t.wzoif9pr422c|here> _(you can also view v0.1 but that's just talk, now v0.2 is all about action)_.

My goal with these office hours is to be your partner in navigating and leveraging AI.

*Please come with your problems and challenges*, and we will pair together to explore how AI can provide solutions. By no means do I consider myself an expert, but I do love learning new things and I've personally haven't been excited about anything in tech for almost over a decade - this much joy last time I had it was almost over a decade ago when Rails 2.0 came out.

*To give you an idea of what I'm already working on with others:*
• Today, in a session with <@UBDB3FVGS>, we decided to experiment with Playwright and Claude Code on Monday. The aim is to see if we can automate the review of specific user journeys and understand how this can aid in accelerating monolith deprecation.
• <@U05NT0X7HLK> also reached out to brainstorm how we might leverage our AI tooling to build prototypes to showcase ideas instead of relying on people to read dozens of WBDs (Working Backwards Documents).
• I'm also developing an <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C08S9HTTYCB/p1756382735169859|"AI Bytes Daily Tips" bot>. This bot will help with micro-steps to encourage everyone to use AI more effectively in their day-to-day work. Once it's ready, I plan to host a showcase demonstrating how I built it and how you could build or "hire" AI agents for your own team.
I look forward to seeing you there and working together on your AI challenges!

Please feel free to share this with PMs on your team as well directly of course but I will have to be picky with problem requests that maximise the most value as we also head into YP 2026. So I also expect you as leaders to do a bit of filtering to help me out here as time is the scarcest of resources.

Looking forward team :slightly_smiling_face:
